name: Villa del Palmar Beach Resort & Spa Los Cabos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights at this resort in February 2012. I had found a package online for an amazing price and of course we had to sit through the 90 minute timeshare presentation. Which, by the way, is NEVER only 90 minutes even when you tell them you have another committment. Too much high pressure. We really liked the resort, the food, the barstaff etc. Didn't like the fact that you must sign for everything even though we were all inclusive and had our bracelets on. No cash at all....just like on a cruise ship. On our last night, we had the bill slipped under our door to review and had the option of filling out the paperwork and it would automatically get charged to our credit card. We chose not to do that because we wanted to pay cash. The next morning upon checkout, we had the correct amount of cash in hand and the desk clerk prints off another bill with a larger amount. Try to get them to explain why the amount went up from about 8 hours before (which by the way we never left our room or charged any additonal charges to it) was nearly impossible. They just kept saying, this is your new bill.....that bill is wrong. But to this day we don't know why it changed. As a result we did end up putting it on our credit card and now that we are home, trying to dispute it with the card company. Just be very careful.....they will try and scam you if they can.
reviews.title: Nice place, but beware of your final bill.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Villa del Palmar for 4 days in February 2012. Some noteworthy points:
reviews.title: Average at best - great views but older hotel and questionable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - not very close to town: about 20-25 minutes walk to town which is doable during the day but taxis are advisable at night ($7-8 each way)
reviews.title: Timeshares ruin the good experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Older hotel: The studio rooms we stayed at were adequately sized but older. American voltage so adaptors are unnecessary. Only one phone per room with no cordless/speaker and that too on the kitchen counter. Wi-Fi is 150 pesos per 24 hours and is terrible - could barely connect to the internet on Iphone/Ipad but managed to log on computer and then internet promptly crashed repeatedly.
reviews.title: Great views of Lands End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Ocean Views are great: we initially had a garden view on the 2nd floor but were upgraded to an ocean view which was actually quite nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.text: We stayed for a week and loved the resort. Our kids 5 and 10 loved the pool area, slide, and the beach. The activities around the pool were fun and kept the kids and my husband and I busy. Service around the pool for food snd drinks was great. Rooms were very clean and cleaned daily. We even enjoyed the fire pit at night to have a drink or two. Will definitely return. Do not believe the bad reviews. Those people must set out to look for any thing that isnt perfect. I don't know how you can complain about beautiful grounds, nice pool, clean rooms, prompt service, and wonderful people.
reviews.title: Great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the bait. Having no idea what to expect, we changed from our typical Caribbean get away that we were booking and signed up for the time share presentation deal. I kinda dreaded the thought of sitting through the presentation but actually learned quite a bit about it, and was even more convinced it wasn't for us - sorry, answer is NO THANK YOU.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, on to the remaining days... Wife loved it. She did the complete spa treatment while I walked into town on the beach to check out the marina, etc. At first, we were impressed with the service and attitude of the employees, (thinking it was a fluke based on past experiences from many other resorts). However, the more we talked to the staff and used their services, the more we were impressed. In fact, we had lotsa fun interacting with them. ALL of them.
reviews.title: Cabo in April

reviews.text: Also, we ended up eating at the resort since we had the all inclusive deal. We've done all inclusive before, and usually end up going out to get real food, passing up the inclusive food. Not this time. The food was buffet or menu, with good selections and quality, and we ended up eating every meal there.
reviews.title: Villa del Palmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is not a long, wide stretch like many East Coast beaches, but rather steep by comparison, much like our Lake Erie beach, and with the same type of sand. It made for more difficult walking but somehow I survived!!
reviews.title: Our opinion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Del Palmar was a beautiful place to stay. We had the opportunity too use a friends time share. Our room was a studio room on the 5th floor with an ocean view ( breathtaking ). We had a 1/2 kitchen....so decided to NOT to pay extra for the ALL inclusive. We did eat at the hotel a couple times & the food was decent but not amazing. We walked into town almost every night and would find some awesome cuisine with live music ( Check out Maria Carona....best Mexican food we have ever had). The beaches were clean and beautiful, the service and staff were wonderful.
reviews.title: Villa Del Palmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ( Dont get caught up in the time share showings....they will try VERY hard ).
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check ou the spa, my services were wonderful & the spa is immaculate.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place To Stay On The Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to come back to beautiful Cabo.
reviews.title: Vacation in Mexico

reviews.text: We stayed at Villa del Palmar from April 16 - 21 and had a blast. We did the Timeshare/All Inclusive deal and found it to be incredible value for money. You sit through a 90 minute presentation ( 2 hours for us and we spoke to people that endured it for nearly 5 hours !) and the rest of the vacation is yours. We did not buy but it was a nice place.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else!!

reviews.text: We were totally put off right from the start by the attack of the 'concierge' who was really working for a different company! The lack of honesty and then subsequent lack of delivery on promises of complimentary wifi in our room (although it's 2012 and we booked the not- so inclusive "all- inclusive"), the concierge would not return my calls and the staff at their desk actually initially denied they knew such a person! I gave up as I didn't want to spend my vacation angry and disappointed. The timeshare and up selling in Cabo is the worst I've experienced.
reviews.title: Time share vultures masking as "concierge"

reviews.text: On the upside, the restaurant and bar service was excellent. We travel frequently and for the price of this last minute vacation, we both enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Special kudos to Juan, a very professional server who made our evenings around the firepit enjoyable. The beach service was good but they seem to be understaffed during the day - maybe they could redeploy the timeshare sharks to staff up the amount of servers :)
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last item of note - we tried to book our departure shuttle at 403pm the evening before our afternoon flight. Sorry, that part closes at 400pm, so please feel free to pay $65usd for a taxi. Crazy.
reviews.title: Pretty awesome stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had limited expectations on this vacation but the unfulfilled promises and feeling misled from the start were real downers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I thought the resort was perfect for our Spring Break getaway. It's not exceptionally great at one particular thing, nor is it bad at any one thing. I thought the food was over priced, but what isn't at resorts?
reviews.title: Our best vacation EVER!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Palmar last july 2011 for one wk. I have been to many resorts in mexico and while the view of the ocean at any hotel is fantastic, this resort qualifies just a 3 star rating.
reviews.title: Not sure why the four star

reviews.text: Pros; you are on the beach- don't have to walk far like in florida. It is right in front of you.
reviews.title: Had an amazing time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms decent, 1 bdrm suite comfortable in size.
reviews.title: ...not for the beach

reviews.text: Cons: Inevitably something in the room will have problems. I.e. a/c, elevator, coffemaker, shower.
reviews.title: Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spoke to many people in the resort who experienced the same kind of difficulties. Te add some reference. I have stayed many times at the Del Arco and for a few years now have talked to people from Palmar.
reviews.title: DO NOT GIVE YOUR PASSWORD FOR ANY REASON

reviews.text: My husband and I would've absolutely hated this place BEFORE we had kids. Now that we're traveling w/ 5 and and 2 year old, we liked it so much that we actually bought a timeshare. This time around, we got this incredible deal through Groupon, around $200 per night for 4 people, ALL INCLUSIVE. It's a bit overwhelming if it's your first time, once you get used to the lay out, it's easy to get around. In fact, riding the trolley around the property was one of the high lights for my kids. We stayed for a whole week and ate pretty much every single meal on the resort. There're plenty of options to choose from. We even had fresh oysters one night at the restaurant at Del Arco. My kids never got tired of fresh pizza (which they had for lunch everyday.) Drinks are sometimes hit and miss, but the beer is always cold and pina coladas are always marvelous.
reviews.title: Great for family w/ kids

reviews.text: We ventured out to the town one day. You can get much better deal on local trips if you just deal w/ those guys in town in person. You just have to stay your ground and be ready to walk away if you don't get the deal you want. There's always the next guy. Our group (I think 12 including the kids) got a boat tour to all the major beaches and spots and a ride back to our hotel for $50. We paid more than that getting into town on a van taxi. The guys went deep sea fishing for half the price of what you can get from the hotel. After they came back w/ a huge yellowtail and some other fish, we just tipped the chef at the hotel and he grilled it for us w/ all the fixings. I've never had fish that had no fish smell at all. It was amazing.
reviews.title: Great beach and view of the Arch

reviews.text: My least favorite place to eat is the buffet. Our favorite was California grill where they serve amazing Italian dishes.
reviews.title: Villa Del Palmar in Cabo is FANTASTIC!

reviews.text: This resort is one of the best for activities for young and old. We have enjoyed our stay in this great resort for over seven years. It has a lot to offer and the location is convenient for the entire city of Cabo San Lucas. Many people walk to the attractions such as dining, marina, shopping and other activities. One of our favorites that we continue to visit each year.The staff here are number one when it comes to reservations and working out details for future visits.
reviews.title: Stay away from buying their timeshare!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Resort is wonderful. If you read the reviews, you will see that the great majority are positive. My wife and I stay here every other summer. We own a "studio" and for two people, or even more (a couple of young children) it works out GREAT. The staff is excellent. Pool side service and food and drink is wonderful. The kids' pool is great. The Whale Slide is special. There is a separate pool for the adults, so your family can enjoy the best of both worlds, or if you are traveling only with adults, you can enjoy the resort without "kid interruption." Walk down the beach to go wave riding in the bay -- what an experience!! And, the restaurants along the beach path walking into town on the sand are all wonderful and reasonably priced. The Resort's own restaurants are fine, and reasonably priced. You can eMail me here within the TripAdvisor site (just create an account) if you want me to share more experiences. In Cabo, my wife and I have done a number of excursions, and we have rented an SUV for the day. All wonderful experiences. Never had any safety issues in Mexico, including Cabo. We have traveled to Puerto Vallarta and the Mayan Riviera. I have a couple of Mexican timeshares, and I would be glad to share with you my insights, and also special promotions offered by the Resorts if you want to travel to Cabo or Puerto Vallarta or Mazitlan or Acapulco or Maya Riviera (30 miles south of Cancun), cheap. Good traveling. Charley
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation
Surprised myself by going back - had a great time
reviews.text: We stayed at this resort last year and although we had a good time, I didn't think we would go back. My mom, who went with us last year and this year, really liked it and wanted to go back. Honestly, I was really surprised that we had an even better time than last year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Knowing exactly what to expect (and not expect) made it really easy to enjoy. We did the All Inclusive again. I really recommend this if you're traveling with children (mine range from mid-teen to nine years old). It's so easy to let everyone eat what and when they want, and the margaritas just kept coming to my beach chair!
reviews.title: Time share sharks ruin the experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't give the resort 5 stars just because a couple of things are lacking: 1) the beds are too small 2) I really hate the theme nights 3) little things here and there where the hotel misses the boat. I wish instead of stupid (and pretty tacky) entertainment, they would just serve the various buffets. The food is surprisingly good, and especially when it's fresh off the grill.
reviews.title: Very friendly and clean resort

reviews.text: However, I also realize that this resort is a TREMENDOUS deal for what you get and that I'm not paying 5 star resort prices. I think it's a great deal and certainly for families. I still feel that I wouldn't stay here if I were on vacation with my husband or with another couple. But for families with kids, you can't beat it.
reviews.title: Berenice & Daniela at the Villa del Palmar

reviews.text: Also, they've really upgraded the extras at the Towel Service desk. In addition to snorkeling equipment, you can borrow boogie boards, pool noodles and stand up paddle boards (that was really fun!!). We didn't have any trouble borrowing these items, sometimes we had to check back, but eventually we were able to borrow anything we needed. They are also super friendly with the towel exchange - never hassling you if you need a dry towel.
reviews.title: Good place overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked this hotel because it was a cheap get away to a place that we haven't been to yet, the only catch was that you had to sit through a time share speel. After hearing all the horror stories about heavy pressure i really apprehensive, but to my suprise it wasnt that bad, it ran a little longer than they said but no biggy we said no and they were fine with it. NOW the resort, our stay tho short was fantastic, the room was clean bed was comfortable, maid service was spot on, food best resort food ever, large variety and mmmgood, nightly activity was always fun, and best of all were the people, always ready to help, and would go that extra step to help, i cant say enough about the staff they make the differance between 4.5 and a 5 star. the resort is not big maybe thats what makes it special. Had a fatastic time thx tons
reviews.title: Suprised

reviews.text: We have stayed here twice over the past few years. The hotel is in a great location on the Medano beach strand. It is walking distance to town if you feel like a hike (its a few miles away) or you can take a cab back and forth, which gets expensive.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel needs some updating

reviews.text: The hotel setting itself is fantastic. Amazing sandy beach right below the hotel but the currents are strong along the beach so you really can't swim there. The restaurants are pretty good and the pools are nice. Service is warm as all lower Mexican (non-border town) resorts are. However, the rooms needs some updating. They already are sparse Mexcian style with tile floors and cement barley decorated. We had a plumbing issue in our first room and they then moved us to another room. In that room the air-conditioning pipes leaked and they had to call maintenance again to resolve that issue. So the physical plant needs some attention.
reviews.title: mostly relaxing trip

reviews.text: We typically trade in a time share for a room here. We trade in a two bedroom and only ever get a one bedroom. I assume this is an interval international issue more than a Villa del Palmar issue.
reviews.title: AWESOME RESORT

reviews.text: All that said I would stay here again for its convenience to town, great beach and fun pools for the kids and adults alike. We have some fond memories there. However, there are a lot of places to chose from in Cabo these days.
reviews.title: Fun

aka: Villa Del Palmar Beach Resort & Spa Los Cabos Hotel Cabo San Lucas
description: Villa del Palmar Beach Resort Los Cabos is "fun" with a capital "F," described by previous guests as "awesome," "enjoyable," and simply, "a great place to get away from it all." Soak up South of the Border comfort at Villa del Palmar Beach Resort Los Cabos, our family-friendly property with newly renovated rooms and an emphasis on entertainment. You can't help but smile the minute you see our Willy the Whale water slide.On any given day, you might see a crowd partaking in aqua-aerobics, water volleyball, or simply slipping and sliding into the pool (don't forget your camera!). In addition, the resort hosts a large variety of on-site activities including scuba diving, cooking lessons, a techno-arcade and theme nights featuring mariachi music, talent shows and more.The property also boasts a walk-out-the-door stretch of powdery sand, with gorgeous views of the turquoise surf and famous rock formation, El Arco. The recently updated all-suite property with its 460 air-conditioned units offers a range of "home away from home" options, be it a one-, two- or three-bedroom suite, sure to satisfy everyone in your group.While the area's beach and water sports get most of the attention, Villa del Palmar goes out of its way to offer the utmost in peace and tranquility.
